refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkGLExt is an extension to GTK which adds OpenGL capabilities to GtkWidget. Its use is quite simple: use gtk_widget_set_gl_capability to add OpenGL support to a widget, it will create a OpenGL drawable (GdkGLDrawable) for the widget, which can be obtained via gtk_widget_get_gl_drawable. OpenGL rendering context (GdkGLContext) can also be obtained via gtk_widget_get_gl_context. With GdkGLDrawable and GdkGLContext, gdk_gl_drawable_gl_begin and gdk_gl_drawable_gl_end can be called, and OpenGL function calls can be made between those two functions.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_set_gl_capability ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_widget_set_gl_capability (GtkWidget *widget, GdkGLConfig *glconfig, GdkGLContext *share_list, gboolean direct, int render_type);
refsect2.para: Set the OpenGL-capability to the widget. This function prepares the widget for its use with OpenGL.

listitem.simpara: the GtkWidget to be used as the rendering area.
the GdkGLContext with which to share display lists and texture objects. NULL indicates that no sharing is to take place.
whether rendering is to be done with a direct connection to the graphics system.
TRUE if it is successful, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_is_gl_capable ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the widget is OpenGL-capable.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the widget is OpenGL-capable, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_get_gl_config ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GdkGLConfig referred by the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_create_gl_context ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkGLContext* gtk_widget_create_gl_context (GtkWidget *widget, GdkGLContext *share_list, gboolean direct, int render_type);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GdkGLContext with the appropriate GdkGLDrawable for this widget. The GL context must be freed when you're finished with it. See also gtk_widget_get_gl_context().

listitem.simpara: the GdkGLContext with which to share display lists and texture objects. NULL indicates that no sharing is to take place.
whether rendering is to be done with a direct connection to the graphics system.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_get_gl_context ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GdkGLContext with the appropriate GdkGLDrawable for this widget. Unlike the GL context returned by gtk_widget_create_gl_context(), this context is owned by the widget.
GdkGLContext is needed for the function gdk_gl_drawable_begin, or for sharing display lists (see gtk_widget_set_gl_capability()).

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_get_gl_window ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GdkGLWindow owned by the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_widget_get_gl_drawable()
refsect2.para: Returns the GdkGLDrawable owned by the widget. In fact, this is macro that casts the result of gtk_widget_get_gl_window to GdkGLDrawable.
